metadata.title: CVE-2018-7889 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: gui2/viewer/bookmarkmanager.py in Calibre 3.18 calls cPickle.load onimported bookmark data, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrarycode via a crafted .pickle file, as demonstrated by Python code thatcontains an os.system call.

criterions.comment: calibre: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
